Generation III.Ruby: Whiscash is extremely territorial. Just one of these Pok é mon will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.
Generation III.Sapphire: If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like tremor with a radius of over three miles . This Pok é mon has the ability to predict real earthquakes.
Generation III.Emerald: Mysteriously, it can foretell earthquakes. In the daytime, it sleeps in mud at the bottom of a pond. When it awakens, it continually feeds throughout the night.
Generation III.FireRed: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything - if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything - if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is very territorial. It repels foes by setting off tremors that extend over a three-mile radius.
Generation IV.Pearl: As a result of causing tremors by thrashing about, it developed the ability to foretell real quakes.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes near it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like tremor with a radius of over three miles . This Pokémon has the ability to predict real earthquakes.

Generation VII.Sun: A glutton that devours anything that moves, it quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps, lying in wait for prey.
Generation VII.Moon: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Whiscash shakes the ground at high intensities to intimidate its opponents. It swallows its prey whole—along with mud from the swamp floor.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its vision is not that good. It senses vibrations in the water with its whiskers to determine the location of its prey.

Generation VIII.Sword: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
Generation VIII.Shield: It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes near it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is very territorial. It repels foes by setting off tremors that extend over a three-mile radius.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: As a result of causing tremors by thrashing about, it developed the ability to foretell real quakes.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.
Generation IX.Violet: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.
